title: Come and work for BikeRadar! We’re looking for a technical writer, sub-editor and SEO editor
content:
Want to work for BikeRadar? This is your chance! We’re recruiting for three new roles in the editorial team.

  • Technical writer (view the job advert)
  • Sub-editor (view the job advert)
  • SEO editor (view the job advert)

Technical writer

If you love riding bikes, fettling bikes and writing about bikes, we’re looking for a new technical writer to join the team. You can write about the things you love every day, sharing your knowledge with our passionate audience of cyclists.

Applications for the technical writer role close on Sunday 14 November.

Sub-editor

We’re also looking for a sub-editor to join BikeRadar. This position sits at the heart of the editorial team and is responsible for organising and editing content across BikeRadar, ensuring copy is accurate, interesting and delivered on time.

Applications for the sub-editor role close on Sunday 14 November.

SEO editor

Meanwhile, BikeRadar’s SEO editor will play a key role in planning, producing and optimising content across the site, helping our market-leading reviews, buyer’s guides and advice articles reach as many riders as possible.

Applications for the SEO editor role close on Sunday 21 November.

Job adverts for all three vacancies are available to view on the Immediate Media website.
author: BikeRadar
